value from all ESMs shows overpredicted forest biomass in Wood
Root by 43.4 Pg C, in wood by 41.5 Pg C, and
in roots by 1.9 Pg C, while the biomass in leaves is underpredicted by 0.2 Pg C. Note that all ESMs predict the bio-
mass in leaves within the uncertainty range of obsESMs, while BNU-ESM and the IPSL ESMs predict too much
forest total biomass and biomass in Wood
Root due to overestimated biomass in wood (Fig.Â 4d). The institu-
tional mean values of forest biomass for each modeling center show enlarged magnitude of bias in total mass
(7.7 Pg C) and biomass in Wood
Root (10.2 Pg C) compared to multi-model mean values. The increased bias
of biomass in wood (14.8 Pg C) is the major cause of the increasing discrepancies, even though the institutional
mean biomass in roots is reduced (
4.57 Pg C). Details of extratropical forest carbon mass across 30Â° Nâ80Â° N
for each ESM and for each modeling center is shown in Supplementary TableÂ S2.
According to the masked forest biomass in ESMs and obsESMs, the magnitude of biases varies over a wide
range. To minimize the influences of various masks applied to ESMs, we evaluate the model uncertainty in
, see Eq. (2) in Methods) so that underestimates or overestimates in model results
